entry.title: Scores detained as anti-government protests continue in Armenia

media:group.media:title: Scores detained as anti-government protests continue in Armenia
media:group.media:description:
üìç At least 151 protesters were detained today in Yerevan for taking part in acts of civil disobedience, according to police figures. Demonstrators continue to call on Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan to resign over last month‚Äôs border deal with Azerbaijan. üìç Armenia and Azerbaijan continue to disagree on key provisions of a normalization deal, after talks over the weekend between the two countries‚Äô top diplomats in Kazakhstan.

üìç Armenia‚Äôs cabinet proposed doubling taxes on small businesses in the country, saying the move is needed to boost transparency and simplify the tax administration system. üìç It remains unclear when Armenia‚Äôs Central Bank will allow the London-based financial giant HSBC to sell off its local subsidiary, leaving the country with no Western banks. üìç Negotiations over a major expansion plan continue between Armenia‚Äôs government and Corporaci√≥n Am√©rica Airports, the company that owns the country‚Äôs main airport.

entry.title: Protest movement in Yerevan demands Prime Minister‚Äôs resignation

media:group.media:title: Protest movement in Yerevan demands Prime Minister‚Äôs resignation
media:group.media:description:
üìç The "Tavush for the Homeland" movement led by Archbishop Bagrat Galstanyan held a rally in Yerevan‚Äôs Republic Square. The demonstrators are demanding Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan's resignation. üìç On a trip to Moscow, Pashinyan reached an agreement with Vladimir Putin to withdraw Russian troops from Armenia's eastern border and Zvartnots International Airport. üìç Dr. Denis Mukwege was awarded the Aurora Prize for Awakening Humanity. Aurora Prize co-founder Ruben Vardanyan is enduring an illegal detainment by Azerbaijan. üìç WATCH MORE: Insights with Eric- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sdWlco8GZEM
